intro: Psychotria brevicalyx, commonly known as the "blue-eyed Mary" or "holy water plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its small, showy blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Psychotria brevicalyx is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
